block.p: Jennifer Jermond Reid and Luis Bolivar Andrade Marquez were married last evening at Preservation Park in Oakland, Calif. Samuel A. Dexter, a friend of the couple who was appointed as a deputy marriage commissioner by Alameda County, officiated.

Ms. Reid, 37, is keeping her name. She is beginning study this month for a master's degree in education at the University of California, Berkeley. Until last month, she was the office manager, in Concord, Calif., for the Taubman Company, a real estate investment trust based in Bloomfield Hills, Mich. She graduated from Brown.

Jennifer Jermond Reid and Luis Bolivar Andrade Marquez were married last evening at Preservation Park in Oakland, Calif. Samuel A. Dexter, a friend of the couple who was appointed as a deputy marriage commissioner by Alameda County, officiated.

Jennifer Jermond Reid and Luis Bolivar Andrade Marquez were married last evening at Preservation Park in Oakland, Calif. Samuel A. Dexter, a friend of the couple who was appointed as a deputy marriage commissioner by Alameda County, officiated.

Ms. Reid, 37, is keeping her name. She is beginning study this month for a master's degree in education at the University of California, Berkeley. Until last month, she was the office manager, in Concord, Calif., for the Taubman Company, a real estate investment trust based in Bloomfield Hills, Mich. She graduated from Brown.

The bride is a daughter of Danielle E. Reid of Sea Bright, N.J., and Thomas H. Reid of Rumson, N.J. Her father, who is retired, worked in New York as the director of property management at LCOR, a real estate development firm based in Berwyn, Pa. Her mother is a vice president and a trust officer at the Provident Bank in Morristown, N.J.
Mr. Andrade, 39, is in charge of product licensing in the South San Francisco, Calif., office of Acronis, a software company in Burlington, Mass. He graduated from Columbia.
The bridegroom is a son of Feliciana R. Andrade of Massapequa, N.Y., and the late Guillermo B. Andrade. His father was a cabinet maker in Guayaquil, Ecuador.
